title: Lúcio Maranhão
text:
Lucielmo Palhano Soares (; born 28 September 1988), also known as Lúcio Maranhão, is a Brazilian professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="Bnei%20Yehuda%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Bnei Yehuda</a> as a <a href="forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
Biography.
Lucio born in <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Lu%C3%ADs%2C%20Maranh%C3%A3o">São Luís, Maranhão</a>, Brazil, and increased local group <a href="Maranh%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Clube">Maranhão</a>. In 2010 moved to the Department of Youth of media <a href="Horizonte%20Futebol%20Clube">Horizonte</a> debut as an actor in his mature group.
During 2012, Lucio has signed a three-year <a href="Agremia%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Sportiva%20Arapiraquense">ASA de Arapiraca</a> and media value of 65 games in which scored 31 goals. During the period it was under contract to ASA de Arapiraca seconded Lucio <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20Vit%C3%B3ria">Vitória</a> groups and <a href="Figueirense%20Futebol%20Clube">Figueirense</a>.
During 2014 it was purchased by a group of Lucio on <a href="Buriram%20United%20F.C.">Buriram United</a> Thai Bdmdih value 7 concerts which scored two goals. In early 2015 he returned to Brazil and signed for the season <a href="Fortaleza%20Esporte%20Clube">Fortaleza</a> media value 37 appearances and scored 7 goals. The following season, he signed <a href="Clube%20de%20Regatas%20Brasil">CRB</a> and beg from media value 35 appearances scored 13 goals in them.
On 17 July 2016 he signed with <a href="Hapoel%20Be%27er%20Sheva%20F.C.">Hapoel Be'er Sheva</a> Lucio three years. On 30 July, Lucio made his first appearance in a 5–0 victory over <a href="Hapoel%20Ashkelon%20F.C.">Hapoel Ashkelon</a> as part of the <a href="Toto%20Cup">Toto Cup</a>, During the game scoring the first goal in the group. On 3 August, Lucio first appeared in the game in the framework the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">Champions League</a> qualification in front of <a href="Olympiacos%20F.C.">Olympiacos</a>. On 11 August won with Hapoel Beer Sheva title of <a href="Israel%20Super%20Cup">Super Cup</a> after winning the <a href="Israel%20State%20Cup">cup</a> holders 4–2 <a href="Maccabi%20Haifa%20F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. Later in the season he won the <a href="Toto%20Cup">Toto Cup</a> with Be'er Sheva. In January's transfer window, Lúcio was loaned to the <a href="F.C.%20Ashdod">F.C. Ashdod</a> until the end of the season.
On 16 July 2017, after being released by, Be'er Sheva, he signed for <a href="Elaz%C4%B1%C4%9Fspor">Elazığspor</a>.
On 23 July 2021, Lúcio signed for <a href="Hapoel%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Hapoel Tel Aviv</a>.
Honours.
